page.title: 08Pubs in Lawshall & Shimpling
page.content: here are now only 2 public houses remaining from the original 4, the other 2,have in recent years,been turned into private dwellings. The first the Swan Inn,Lawshall, although no longer used as an inn,is thriving as a pub under new management.The building is C18 timber framed & plastered with a thatched roof and is well maintained. Owned by the local brewery,Greene King. The second is the Bush Inn, Shimpling, also owned by Green King.This beautiful C16 timber framed and plastered build- ing,typifies the English Village Pub, with it's landscaped garden, fish pond, stream with ducks,crossed by a rustic bridge,garden swings and amusements for children, tables & chairs with para- soles for summer evenings, and inside an oak beamed bar & dining room with a blazing log fire in the inglenook, for the cold winter nights.
